about.name: Kyoto
about.info_text: Kyoto, often referred to as the 'City of Ten Thousand Shrines,' is a city in Japan known for its rich history, traditional culture, and stunning temples. As the former imperial capital of Japan, Kyoto is a place where ancient traditions are beautifully preserved. Visitors can explore well-preserved historic districts, participate in tea ceremonies, and admire the elegance of geisha culture. Kyoto is a serene and enchanting city that offers a glimpse into Japan's past.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.46 million
Prefecture: Kyoto Prefecture
Time Zone: Japan Standard Time (UTC+09:00)
Language: Japanese
Currency: Japanese Yen (JPY)
about.climate_text: Kyoto experiences a humid subtropical climate with hot, humid summers and cool, dry winters. The city is particularly beautiful during the cherry blossom season in spring and the colorful foliage of autumn.

attractions_card.title: Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion)
attractions_card.description: Kinkaku-ji, or the Golden Pavilion, is a Zen Buddhist temple covered in gold leaf, set in beautiful gardens with a reflective pond.

attractions_card.title: Fushimi Inari Taisha
attractions_card.description: Fushimi Inari Taisha is a famous Shinto shrine known for its thousands of vermillion torii gates, creating a mesmerizing tunnel-like path.

attractions_card.title: Gion District
attractions_card.description: Gion is Kyoto's historic geisha district, where visitors can spot geisha and maiko (apprentice geisha) in traditional attire.

attractions_card.title: Arashiyama Bamboo Grove
attractions_card.description: Arashiyama Bamboo Grove is a picturesque bamboo forest, creating a tranquil and otherworldly atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: Kiyomizu-dera Temple
attractions_card.description: Kiyomizu-dera is an iconic Buddhist temple known for its wooden stage that offers panoramic views of Kyoto and cherry blossoms in spring.

attractions_card.title: Kyoto Imperial Palace
attractions_card.description: Kyoto Imperial Palace is the former residence of the Imperial family and features beautiful gardens and historic structures.

attractions_card.title: Nijo Castle
attractions_card.description: Nijo Castle is a UNESCO World Heritage site, known for its ornate interiors and 'nightingale floors' that chirp when walked upon.

attractions_card.title: Philosopher's Path
attractions_card.description: Philosopher's Path is a picturesque walk along a canal lined with hundreds of cherry trees, making it a prime spot for hanami (flower viewing).

food_card.title: Kaiseki
food_card.description: Kaiseki is a traditional multi-course Japanese meal that emphasizes seasonal and local ingredients, artfully presented.

food_card.title: Sushi
food_card.description: Kyoto offers delectable sushi with fresh, high-quality seafood. Many sushi restaurants focus on traditional preparation and flavors.

food_card.title: Matcha Tea
food_card.description: Kyoto is renowned for its matcha (green tea). Visitors can enjoy matcha in various forms, from tea ceremonies to matcha-flavored sweets.

food_card.title: Yudofu
food_card.description: Yudofu is a simple and delicious Kyoto specialty, featuring soft tofu served in a savory soy-based broth.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton Kyoto
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton Kyoto is a luxurious hotel with a prime location along the Kamogawa River, offering elegant rooms and exquisite dining options.

hotels_card.title: Hyatt Regency Kyoto
hotels_card.description: Hyatt Regency Kyoto is a sophisticated hotel that combines modern comfort with traditional Japanese aesthetics in the Higashiyama district.

hotels_card.title: Gion Hatanaka Ryokan
hotels_card.description: Gion Hatanaka Ryokan is a traditional Japanese inn with tatami mat rooms, offering an authentic ryokan experience in the Gion geisha district.

hotels_card.title: The Westin Miyako Kyoto
hotels_card.description: The Westin Miyako Kyoto is set in a scenic location on the eastern hills of Kyoto, providing a peaceful retreat with modern amenities.

transport_card.title: JR Kyoto Station
transport_card.description: JR Kyoto Station is a major transportation hub with shinkansen (bullet train) access and a wide range of facilities and services.

transport_card.title: City Bus and Subway
transport_card.description: Kyoto's city bus and subway network is a convenient way to explore the city, with various passes available for tourists.

transport_card.title: Bicycles
transport_card.description: Bicycles are a popular means of transportation in Kyoto, offering an eco-friendly and enjoyable way to see the city's sights.

transport_card.title: Taxi
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Kyoto and offer a comfortable and convenient way to reach specific destinations.

transport_card.title: Kansai International Airport
transport_card.description: Kansai International Airport is the main gateway to Kyoto and the Kansai region, serving domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Itami Airport
transport_card.description: Itami Airport, also known as Osaka International Airport, provides domestic flights and is accessible from Kyoto.
